channel.title: A 'New'bie Question
channel.description:
Does anyone know where i can change the starter outfit ? Because the basic one is kind of stupid and i want to change it to a halloween outfit :D I can find the ID's on the Mopar Item ID list but i dont know where to edit it
EDIT : Question 2 :D I would like to have Special Attacks , since they are hard to get on a server , i want to be one that has them :D If so , i would like to know where (exactly, if you tell me to put it in Client.java i dont know where heh :rolleyes:) And what code do i have to add
Thanks :cool:

item.title: A 'New'bie Question
item.dc:creator: @Gazmask Gazmask
item.description:
@Gazmask wrote:

[quote=“Thedup, post:11, topic:155511”]EDIT : Question 2
I would like to have Special Attacks , since they are hard to get on a server , i want to be one that has them
If so , i would like to know where (exactly, if you tell me to put it in Client.java i dont know where heh )
And what code do i have to add

Thanks

Ok, Here’s a link for the Specs.
http://www.rune-server.org/showthread.php?t=17780
Your Welcome. :P[/quote]
Thanks you rule :D[br][size=1]Posted on: October 30, 2007, 06:00:11 AM[/size][hr]Right that tut is way to hard for me … he says add this to client , this to graphic handler , and if you don’t have this : add this
Then i’m like wth ?

Read full topic

item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

np c+p it to desktop in word doc just incase

Read full topic

item.title: A 'New'bie Question
item.dc:creator: @Gazmask Gazmask
item.description:
@Gazmask wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:8, topic:155511”]STEP 1:
[color=red]Im makin this on the spot so its not so good,
Open player.java and hit ctrl+f (search)

		//Giving the player an unique look

[color=blue]Then look below it, there should be somethin that looks like this:

		playerEquipment[playerHat]=2637;
		playerEquipment[playerCape]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585;
		playerEquipment[playerChest]=6402;
		playerEquipment[playerShield]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerLegs]=6398;
		playerEquipment[playerHands]=6922;
		playerEquipment[playerFeet]=6920;
		playerEquipment[playerRing]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=5018;

[color=orange]playerEquipment[playerHat]=####; = Hat/helm
playerEquipment[playerCape]=####; = cape
playerEquipmentplayerAmulet]=####; = amulet/neckalece
playerEquipment[playerChest]=####; = Plate Body …
playerEquipment[playerShield]=####; = Shield (sq or kite, or book…)
playerEquipment[playerLegs]=####; = PlateLegs or legs
playerEquipment[playerHands]=####; = Gloves (not wep)
playerEquipment[playerFeet]=#### = boots, shoes
playerEquipment[playerRing]=#### = ring
playerEquipment[playerArrows]=####; = arrows
playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=####; = weapon

#### = the ID of the item

If you dont want an item , just put -1 as the id , so if I dont want arrows:

		playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1;

CREDITZ: 100%me

ANTI-LEECH![/quote]
Already found that out
Thanks anyways Tobias222

Read full topic

item.title: A 'New'bie Question
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

STEP 1:
[color=red]Im makin this on the spot so its not so good,
Open player.java and hit ctrl+f (search)

		//Giving the player an unique look

[color=blue]Then look below it, there should be somethin that looks like this:

		playerEquipment[playerHat]=2637;
		playerEquipment[playerCape]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585;
		playerEquipment[playerChest]=6402;
		playerEquipment[playerShield]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerLegs]=6398;
		playerEquipment[playerHands]=6922;
		playerEquipment[playerFeet]=6920;
		playerEquipment[playerRing]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1;
		playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=5018;

[color=orange]playerEquipment[playerHat]=####; = Hat/helm
playerEquipment[playerCape]=####; = cape
playerEquipmentplayerAmulet]=####; = amulet/neckalece
playerEquipment[playerChest]=####; = Plate Body …
playerEquipment[playerShield]=####; = Shield (sq or kite, or book…)
playerEquipment[playerLegs]=####; = PlateLegs or legs
playerEquipment[playerHands]=####; = Gloves (not wep)
playerEquipment[playerFeet]=#### = boots, shoes
playerEquipment[playerRing]=#### = ring
playerEquipment[playerArrows]=####; = arrows
playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=####; = weapon

#### = the ID of the item

If you dont want an item , just put -1 as the id , so if I dont want arrows:

		playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1;

CREDITZ: 100%me

ANTI-LEECH!

Read full topic

item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

world-pk-scape:

tut to specials wer never on mopar and #A-M i donnno where in player.java where do i search =)

Player.java

Do Ctrl F then type in the ID. You should see something like PlayHat maybe… can’t remember. Edit the numbers near the things that specify where the item is.

I confused myself too.
